Name: Alert Dialog
Description: A modal dialog that interrupts the user with important content and expects a response.

SubComponentData.Name: Root
SubComponentData.Description: Contains all the parts of an alert dialog.

PropData.Name: defaultOpen
PropData.Description: The open state of the dialog when it is initially rendered. Use when you do not need to control its open state.

PropData.Name: open
PropData.Description: The controlled open state of the dialog. Must be used in conjunction with onOpenChange.

PropData.Name: onOpenChange
PropData.Description: Event handler called when the open state of the dialog changes.

SubComponentData.Name: Trigger
SubComponentData.Description: A button that opens the dialog.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Event handler called when the open state of the dialog changes.

SubComponentData.Name: Portal
SubComponentData.Description: When used, portals your overlay and content parts into the body.

PropData.Name: forceMount
PropData.Description: Used to force mounting when more control is needed. Useful when controlling animation with React animation libraries. If used on this part, it will be inherited by AlertDialog.Overlay and AlertDialog.Content.

PropData.Name: container
PropData.Description: Specify a container element to portal the content into.

SubComponentData.Name: Overlay
SubComponentData.Description: A layer that covers the inert portion of the view when the dialog is open.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

PropData.Name: forceMount
PropData.Description: Used to force mounting when more control is needed. Useful when controlling animation with React animation libraries. It inherits from AlertDialog.Portal.

SubComponentData.Name: Content
SubComponentData.Description: Contains content to be rendered when the dialog is open.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

PropData.Name: forceMount
PropData.Description: Used to force mounting when more control is needed. Useful when controlling animation with React animation libraries. It inherits from AlertDialog.Portal.

PropData.Name: onOpenAutoFocus
PropData.Description: Event handler called when focus moves to the destructive action after opening. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

PropData.Name: onCloseAutoFocus
PropData.Description: Event handler called when focus moves to the destructive action after opening. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

PropData.Name: onEscapeKeyDown
PropData.Description: Event handler called when focus moves to the trigger after closing. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

SubComponentData.Name: Cancel
SubComponentData.Description: A button that closes the dialog. This button should be distinguished visually from AlertDialog.Action buttons.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Event handler called when the escape key is down. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

SubComponentData.Name: Action
SubComponentData.Description: A button that closes the dialog. These buttons should be distinguished visually from the AlertDialog.Cancel button.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

SubComponentData.Name: Title
SubComponentData.Description: An accessible name to be announced when the dialog is opened. Alternatively, you can provide aria-label or aria-labelledby to AlertDialog.Content and exclude this component.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

SubComponentData.Name: Description
SubComponentData.Description: An accessible description to be announced when the dialog is opened. Alternatively, you can provide aria-describedby to AlertDialog.Content and exclude this component.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.
